comments:
I would like to use the free KAffe Java virtual machine but eclipse can't start
with it.

Kaffe is not a VM that we at Eclipse officially support and the Kaffe website acknowledges that Eclipse does 
not work.  This bug should probably be taken to the Kaffe developers.  Passing onto Runtime for 
comment/closure.

Closing as invalid as per Kim's comment.
Which kind of error did  you get?

At least on IRC, there have been reports of success using kaffe to start
Eclipse, however there seem to be some bugs with how Kaffe does the library
paths which you need to work around by creatively setting -Djava.library.path on
startup.

If you're having trouble, try #kaffe or #classpath on irc.freenode.net.

(In reply to comment #0)
> I would like to use the free KAffe Java virtual machine but eclipse can't start
> with it.

An exception occurred while writing to the platform log:
java.lang.NullPointerException
   at java.lang.VMThrowable.getStackTrace (VMThrowable.java)
   at java.lang.Throwable.getStackTrace (Throwable.java:516)
   at java.lang.Throwable.stackTraceString (Throwable.java:424)
   at java.lang.Throwable.printStackTrace (Throwable.java:400)
   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseLog.getStackTrace
(EclipseLog.java:311)
   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseLog.writeStack (EclipseLog.java:367)
   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseLog.writeLog (EclipseLog.java:332)
   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseLog.log (EclipseLog.java:203)
   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseLog.log (EclipseLog.java:191)
   at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.publishFrameworkEventPrivileged
(Framework.java:1331)
   at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.publishFrameworkEvent
(Framework.java:1314)
   at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.resumeBundles
(StartLevelManager.java:560)
   at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.incFWSL
(StartLevelManager.java:477)
   at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.doSetStartLevel
(StartLevelManager.java:273)
   at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.launch
(StartLevelManager.java:243)
   at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.SystemBundle.resume
(SystemBundle.java:166)
   at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.launch (Framework.java:425)
   at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.OSGi.launch (OSGi.java:51)
   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.startup
(EclipseStarter.java:216)
   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run (EclipseStarter.java:127)
   at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke0 (Method.java)
   at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Method.java:255)
   at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun (Main.java:185)
   at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run (Main.java:704)
   at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main (Main.java:688)
Logging to the console instead.

That's definetly a problem in the class library / VM that should be reported to
Kaffe.

For Eclipse 3.1M6, I did succeed with Kaffe: 
  http://www.kaffe.org/pipermail/kaffe/2005-April/102028.html
For Eclipse 3.0.1, I did succeed with Kaffe, too:
  http://pogo.kaffe.org/pipermail/kaffe/2005-March/101701.html

The screenshots are located in official Kaffe.org website:
  http://www.kaffe.org/screenshots_eclipse.shtml

Please update your Kaffe runtime to version 1.1.5 or recent cvs repository. Thanks!
